name: Creative Labs Pebble 2.0 4.4 W Speakers
comments: Got these for a bit more than I should have paid, but I'm not upset about that. They're great for playing games that I don't need headphones for, and for watching Youtube/listening to Spotify while I do homework and such. The base is a bit iffy at times, but you get what you pay for. For the $30 I paid I'd have got something else, but for the $20 they sell for at sane retailers, they're great.
CRAZY GOOD FOR 20 BUCKS! For the price they sound good and surprisingly have some good bass, not much of any sub bass but for 20 buck speakers with no sub, pretty dang good.
These are really great. They look amazing, sound amazing and get really loud if you want them to.
I cannot recommend these enough, they sound great. I cannot believe the low price tag.
Not the best speakers in the world, but great value.

Great little speakers, same audio quality if not better as my Corsair HS55 headset, pretty loud too. a little bit bigger than I thought they would be, but not really an issue. Great value for $35 AUD.
Cheap, but excellent speakers that get the job done well.
They're $20.....Not much to expect other than they work and have somewhat okayish sound. Which they do. Wish they were louder but....again....they're $20
Excellent sounding speakers for ¬£20, well worth it for the budget setup.
The wires are not great, but the simple design and impressive sound quality make up for the cheap build quality. Definitely a must-have for any desk setup.

name: Logitech Z207 (Black) 10 mW Speakers
comments:
These are by far the nicest desktop speakers I've ever used.
The sound coming from each is crisp and vibrant. The bass is solid but won't rattle your desk or wake up your neighbours. Their clean and contemporary appearance pairs nicely with my monitor, almost disappearing behind it. Their relatively small 90 x 124 mm footprint is a big plus for me.
clear sound and good price and I like the Bluetooth option so much, I highly recommend it.
Pretty good, but be aware they are big
These little speakers are quite excellent! I was positively surprised that these were so cheap and still performed this well.

Good but not amazing for the price. Definitely lacking a bit in the bass (kind of to be expected for the size of driver), but the styling is at least very nice looking. The pre-amp for the headphone jack is good though, and the dial turns nice and smooth/precisely with a satisfying click when turning on/off.
Good volume range for the price.
If you're not expecting anything crazy, these speakers are great for the price.
Sound damn good for the price.

name: Creative Labs Pebble 2.0 4.4 W Speakers
comments: Great speakers for 18 dollars?!?!?!?!?!? I love these speakers. They sound and look insanely good and for only 18 bucks, they just can not be beat.

One of the speakers doesn‚Äôt work I‚Äôm still trying to fix it, but otherwise that one speaker itself is really loud and has a lot of base once I get the other speed working it‚Äôs probably gonna be really good but the fact that it doesn‚Äôt come with the speaker ready and easy just to plug-in just still ruins it
best budget speakers that I've had in my whole life
Does the job, leagues better than my monitor's integrated speakers and better than I expected for only $30

The audio sounds really good for the price, looks great, only complaint is how they are wired. I wish the wires connecting them were all detachable or replaceable, I just get concerned about them getting yanked accidentally and breaking, then you would have to order a whole new set of speakers rather than just a new cord.

In general I really like these speakers. The audio and the bass are really nice and I like the small and clean design. They are also very cheap for their quality. My only point of criticism is that sometimes when the pc turns off the speakers make a low bass sound if they were still playing music. But overall I would really recommend this product.
The best speakers to get for the price, only paid $20.
surprisingly good for ¬£20
i paid $20 for them!!! You can listen to videos, movies or games just fine. If you want to listen to perfect bass and music you should buy something else.
Got these speakers in black and they work exactly as I wanted them to.

name: Razer Leviathan V2 X 65 W Speakers
comments: Great value soundbar, though it does lack some bass and power. If you are prompted to install Synapse, discard it, it's not necessary.
Doesn‚Äôt provide the best audio, but is still a solid option if you like to look if soundbars. Also it has RGB.

name: Logitech Z906 500 W 5.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
THX Certified
Digital decoding
Easy-to-read control console
Ported, side-firing subwoofer
Wall-mountable satellites
Surround sound with 3D Stereo
Works with: - Computers, music players, TVs, Blu-ray and DVD players, game consoles and other audio sources with digital optical, digital coaxial, RCA audio or 3.5 mm out
- Nintendo Wii using the AV cable that comes with your console

comments:
Works great, a little expensive though, if you're looking for something that sounds really good but doesn't cost as much, I would highly recommend the Logitech 2.1 Z623, which was my previous set and sounded fantastic for the price.
I am currently only using this in 2.1 format anyway as it's just such a pain running cords around the room in 5.1 format.
Wow you want home theatre experience with some major thump , this system will rock you out of your gaming chair lol. High quality sound that can be tailored to your listening pleasure.
Awesome PC Surround system. Has lots of power to rattle the house.
It keeps the sound like the first day and does not get hot like other sound devices, it creates a very comfortable environment.

I have the 1000W apparently limited edition and it works wonders, the quality is amazing depending on where and how you place the speakers. Apart from the Bluetooth Logitec BT Adapter system to remotely control the speakers, it is the best

Great sound quality, very loud when wanted but doesn't support 192 kHz sampling rate (maximum 96 kHz) or Microsoft WMA Pro Audio audio format codec when connected via optical / SPDIF. Support until 32-bit 192kHz in classic multi-jack connectivity but you lose the performance of the internal audio decoder.
Totally support DTS and Dolby Digital, sending DTS:X or Dolby Atmos is also decoded. Copper wires are fragile, take care of it when installing the speakers.

Great sound system ( when I actually get to use it ). Good sound, really immersive ones on and running off optical lead to pc so not too much clutter. Again, had it on sale so really a great piece of kit for the money.
Best compact solution for a 5.1 audio.

I've been using Logitech Z5500 kit for a long time with my previous PC and its "natural heir" did not disappoint me at all: plenty of power, clear sound, beefy basses and a nice look - even if without any particular peak - make this 5.1 kit just ideal for gaming, you cannot find anything better for this price.
no 5.1 pc sets Close to this, best of the ... unless you are going hifi

name: Edifier MR4 42 W Speakers
comments: beautiful speakers with crisp and clear sound

name: Edifier MR4 42 W Speakers
comments: Got a refurbished pair for $100 CAD and they've been working well. Just note that it does not come with balanced cables, so you'll have to purchase those separately.
Good speakers.
Great budget speakers, noticably better then R1280T

name: Creative Labs Pebble Plus 8 W 2.1-Channel Speakers
comments: Best speakers at this price point. Wish the cord between LT speakers was longer, but not a big deal.

For the price [~$30 - $40], these are really good speakers. They get really loud [although I don't recommend doing so as you'll hear that static sound once you pass a certain threshold], have a nice amount of bass and sense of depth, and look nice. Only downside to this is the fact that the wires are pretty short, so if the device you're gonna connect it to is over ~3 ft., I'd consider getting extensions or moving the device a little closer to the speakers or vice versa.
Not very much bass, but for $45 these are great.

name: Cyber Acoustics CA-2016WB 3 W Speakers

specs.Features:
USB powered stereo speaker
Volume control
Power on/off switch
Headphone output jack
LED power indicator
Magnetically shielded
Cloth grill

comments: These speakers are noisy with a lot of static/interference noise. I didn't realize the TV I am temporarily using for setup provides sound so I never needed these speakers. I had bought these speakers in part because they are powered from a USB plug and not AC. They were cheap.

name: Logitech Z623 200 W 2.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
THX-certified 2.1 speaker system brings your music, movies and games to life in immersive studio-quality audio
200 watts (RMS) gives you the power to listen as loud as you want to
RCA and 3.5mm inputs make it easy to plug in up to three audio devices‚Äîyour computer, iPod, game console, DVD player and more
Two satellite speakers and a powerful subwoofer deliver sound big enough to fill even large entertainment rooms
On-speaker controls lets you easily dial the volume and bass up or down

comments: Very nice speaker and sub set

Decently quality audio that's loud and powerful. Can definitely wake up your roommate, maybe even the neighbor. The volume and bass nob on one of the speakers is a nice touch that I use. Fits nicely under my desk.
Great sound and bass for the price. If you're an audiophile... well, you probably scoff at these, but for the average person they are an awesome option.

They're great speakers. It's the first set of speakers I've ever owned that came with a sub-woofer, and it's pretty fun cranking it up to feel the booms in your chest cavity. It's a massive improvement on the monitor sound that the monitor I ordered has. There's no comparison to be had. Very nice speakers for a very nice price point.
Almost 10 years old already? Or even longer and still lasting. Very good set for the price.

These can sound just a little bit muddy, but they are much clearer than the vast majority of computer speakers you will find. Buying them refurbished is always a great deal and you can usually find them around 100 dollars. My go-to set of speakers for all systems I build.
Excellent sound in a PC-Speaker format. The cables are a just long enough to work, but can be too short for some setups.
I love them, my sister hates them. Very nice bass and sound very natural.

Sound quality is decent. The amount of bass this sub puts out is absurd. If you like large bass output this is definitely what you want. Volume knob feels vague and has terrible feedback through the speakers. Overall, it's pretty decent for the price.
Where to even start on these speakers, they're amazing. The volume and bass control is stunning, it can shake the pictures in the living room from my room.

name: Klipsch ProMedia 2.1 120 W 2.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
Maximum Acoustic Output: 106dB SPL
Amplifier: Digital/Linear A/B amplifier with discrete MOSFET output power section
Satellites: Two-way system using 0.75" polymer dome tweeter with a MicroTractrix Horn and one 3" long-throw midBass driver
Subwoofer: Side-firing 6.5" long-throw driver

comments: Excellent wired 2.1 speakers. Great sound quality. Affordable. No notes.

The Klipsch ProMedia system brings true audiophile performance to PC sound. Since I put myself through college selling audio equipment, these are the ONLY speakers I found that match what I would put in my family room. The sound is incredible. Crisp highs, great soundstage, clear vocals, wide dynamic range and a subwoofer that produces clean bass notes, unlike the resonating thumps you hear from the car 2 lanes over at a stoplight.
You can't buy better sounding speakers for the money. They not only come from one of the pioneers of the Audio Industry, they are also one of the few speaker systems to pass the rigorous THX standards.
Terrific and timeless.
This is my second set of ProMedia's in the last 10 years. This 2.1 setup has always sounded great to my ears.

I do not know a whole lot about audio numbers but I can tell that these have great sound quality. Only thing that you have to do to set up that is kind of a hassle is to fit the ends of those wires for the 2 speakers into the sub woofer which acts as the main power supply. The subwoofer is amazing to have by the way.
Awesome speakers. Wish I could give more input but I‚Äôm not really a audio guyü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

I initially debated between these and the Logitech Z623. I ended up going with the Cyber Acoustics CA-3810 speakers for $67, thinking that I might as well save $40 because there can't be that much difference, right? I WAS SO WRONG. The CA speakers were "cheap" looking and sounding- which one should probably expect for $67 -but it just wasn't going to cut it. I returned them and bought the Klipsch instead. Holy cow, worth every penny. Let's just say one of my favorite things to do now is fire up a THX sound test video on YouTube and blow myself away.

I'm a rookie audiophile. I got this 2.1 set on clearance for $70 at walmart. I'm very happy with them. The LED is tooooo bright and the speakers pop when power cycled so I have to leave them on at all times else I worry something will break. I just really like the style of this set too. Subwoofer works great for me. Easy to set up, just make sure to plug that old school vga-type cable from the right speaker into the subwoofer, then plug the one green wire into your PC's speaker/headphone jack and you're good to go.
Loud and clear, dont mess up right and left like me

Picked up these bad boys up for around 90$ on sale and holy cow they are absolutely incredible. They can go LOUD. The base is very punch and they do not feel like they are lacking anything in any area. I would recommend these to absolutely anyone. I work with Studio One a lot and so far I have been very impressed. The biggest con is that they are always on unless you unplug them all the time - which you should not do. Other than that these are fantastic. I use these speakers with a Creative Labs Sound Blaster Audigy Rx 24-bit 192 kHz Sound Card and the sound is crisp and the base is punchy. I reccomend.

name: Logitech G560 120 W 2.1-Channel Speakers
comments: Great speakers, sound nice and look good.
Really good speakers. Still with us all the way since 2018!

I absolutely love this 2.1 system. I'm not an audiophile, so I can't really tell much from a sound quality point of view (but I know it's definitely good enough for me), but the lighting is where it shines. Unmatched decoration potential, gorgeous bright effects that can shine and reflect off the wall behind the desk. I would not swap this for anything else out there.
Really nice sound quality.
I'm not an audiophile so these speakers have met all my expectations and no complaints.
Sounds good for the price point, and has RGB, what's not to like?

After the latest update the subwoofer level is controlable so we can go boom!
Have not had the same G-hub issues as many many others so pretty happy.

For the money, this was a great deal. The RGB looks nice against the wall, especially when playing music. The speakers are a real upgrade to the TV when I can use them and the subwoofer provides more than enough bass for my music tastes. Will update once I game a bit, to give an honest appraisal on explosions and related effects.

Good speakers, the right satelite speaker buzzes a bit, but it has mostly gone away, it only happens for a few seconds every couple of weeks now. There is a glitch where the rgb backlight on the speakers turns off after ~20 mins of no sound output (even when the "turn off rgb after user inactivity" option is off), but I discovered that having Logitech g hub installed and then installing Logitech gaming software seems to have fixed it.

Love the quality of these speakers, super loud and packs a punch. At max volume you cannot sit in the same room as them as its so damn loud and yet the sound quality is not lost. The base makes the whole house shake and the slimulated 7.1 sounds fantastic. The RBG is gorgeous and pairs super well with other Logitech devices.

name: Logitech X-540 70 W 5.1-Channel Speakers
comments: My speakers are actually older Logitech G5.1 with Micca MB42X added as the Left/Right stereo pair. They sound awesome!

These are awesome computer speakers that have withstood the test of time. I picked them up for $10 at a local goodwill and they have been great. I am in process of installing an Onkyo/Polk 7.1 surround sound in my office right now that will replace these but I'm sure I can find another computer around the house that can use them.

name: Logitech S150 2.4 W Speakers
comments: They make sound and were easy to install. I've had them for a couple of years and they haven't blown out.
Cheap speakers. They're actually good and VERY loud for being only 2.4w. Even in an average-sized guest bedroom (which is my room) I can hear them loud and clear at 2% volume.
Cheap speakers, fine for general use

name: Creative Labs Stage Air V2 10 W Speakers
comments: Mostly just use this for watching movies from my bed when I'm not using my headphones, although could easily ditch the headphones for most things since this is absolutely brill. Sound is awesome and incredibly easy to use. Nice that its bluetooth too since I can connect my phone to it as well which wasn't a factor when buying but has come in useful so many times
Good soundbar for your PC, under the monitor. Does the job, good price.

name: Logitech Z313 25 W 2.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
The control pod makes it easy to control volume and headphone controls.
The compact subwoofer fits into tight spaces and delivers deeper bass when you want to feel the beat.
With its easy setup, just connect the speakers to the subwoofer, and plug the subwoofer into your computer.

comments: Super duper good for the price-point. I don't know what else to say other than I've never had any complaints.

I have a lot of time with this equipment, the only thing that has failed me was that some cable broke, I simply changed it but with almost 10 years that has with me and I even consider it part of the family hahaha
had this unit for something like 15 years and still works perfectly.
Very good Mouse for work, gaming and to listen to music.
They speak well enough for my standards. Sometimes they picked up a buzzing noise that came from my old PC though. I have an issue with them every once in a while but I would still buy them again.
Great speakers for the price. Good enough sound quality. Being able to use speakers instead of headphones sometimes is pretty helpful
Very bassy
its pretty loud and good for movies, games, music. u can have a party with these speakers.

My speakers arrived about 4 days after I had built and was using my pc, it was a game changer. These might not be the best speakers but if you're not speaker over $100-$200, get these speakers and chill.

They're cheap and come with a sub. I barely use them, but they sound good to me. They do buzz when turned on and nothing is playing, plus they're a pain in the butt to set up because of how each part is connected.

name: Creative Labs Pebble Pro 30 W Speakers
Creative Labs T60 60 W Speakers
comments: LOUD SOUND with balanced BASS and treble, clear audio and crisp dialogue
2.0 Speaker System, Clear audio, Built-in DAC, Ideal for gaming, movies, and general use, compact size with good sound quality.

I am seriously impressed by these speakers. I work in the audio field and I listen to high end speakers often. These are very full sounding, punchy mids, creamy lows, crisp highs. They have EQ settings and essentailly sound staging built in, so you can really dial in the sound for whatever you're listening to. Podcasts, video games, movies, music, you can adjust it to make each of these pop in just the right way. For the price, these are some of the best speakers I've ever used.

name: Sony HT-S100F Soundbar 44 W Speakers
comments: Snazzy!

name: Creative Labs Pebble V3 8 W Speakers
comments: Monumental upgrade over monitor speakers, obviously won't compare to anything expensive but they're compact, and sound is room-filling a lot more than I expected.

name: Klipsch R-51PM 120 W Speakers
comments: Looks great, sounds great.
These along with the sub and center channel are works of art.
Clean and pumpin' speakers.

I upgraded from the Leviathan PC sound bar to the Klipsch powered book shelf speaker, paired with the 10" Subwoofer. I love the sound this system provides. It's compact enough and produces incredible sound. The woofer really pounds in games, my neighbors tell me to keep it down! These bookshelf speakers provide 4 ways to connect and is smart enough to identify the source without me having to turn on the speakers or switch input. Well done!!!

name: Creative Labs Pebble V2 8 W Speakers
comments: I like the design and the sound, not boxy at all and loud enough. Takes power from a USB (A or C) port only, which is also a plus.
The sound quality is very good. At the start the sound was very weird in counter strike but i either got used to it or it was a bug.
Obviously not going to have the same audio quality as a ¬£150-200+ speaker but for just over ¬£20 this is pretty excellent value for decent little speakers.
Good quality and cheap!
Nice sounding cheap little speakers. Bass is surprisingly good. Would definitely recommend these as a budget speaker for ~$50
Good enough. Pretty standard and average though.
needed so i can play children videos to my brother. it is really good but dont forget to plug both the audio cable into the line channel and usb-c for power.
Nice speakers for simply listening to videos, or chilling to music. Don't expect perfect sound quality, though.

You get what you pay for I guess but I was disappointed by the sound quality on these. Very weak and muddy sound, in retrospect I think you're better off spending a bit more for better sound unless your criteria for criteria for speakers is only "technically makes sound".
Nice! Great volume for a casual desktop. I use them for everything from gaming to youtube to spotify and they are a great improvement over my crap earbuds. The look wicked nice too, almost fancy.

name: Razer Leviathan V2 65 W 2.1-Channel Speakers
comments: Subwoofer needs a manual dial on it. Its doesn't add much bass. The lighting on the bottom of the bar is incredibly weak. You won't get very good sound out of it unless you have Razer Synapse installed. But other than that. It serves its purpose.

name: Logitech Z150 Speakers

specs.Features:
Rich stereo sound: Two 2-"drivers deliver 6 watts of peak power for clear, loud stereo sound
Connect two devices at the same time: Simultaneously connect your smartphone plus tablet or laptop via a 3; 5mm audio input plus auxiliary line
Convenient controls: Front panel volume and power are combined into one easy-access control knob
Handy headphone jack: Listen to music, movies and games in total privacy
Durable, compact design: Built to last with high-quality acoustics, tested and tuned at Logitech's state-of-the art audio labs

comments: Decent speakers for the price. I use my headset more than I use speakers but there are times when I want to use speakers instead.

These speakers are older than I can remember and having been across three builds now and are still going decently enough and I can't tolerate headsets well. I just wouldn't recommend current pricing for them when you could probably get better speakers with more features that aren't dated- if you find them cheap, definitely worth it though.
Just standard speakers

Here I am going to use the same review for the same pieces:
I got the Z150 speakers to harmonize my work environment, they sound very good and if you are not a demanding audiophile but rather a guy who is enthusiastic about Micheal Bay and the deep basses of Laurent Garnier live at Elysee Montmartre, Paris, France they are ideal for you, however if you need to feel the bass of the Massive Atack Mezzanine you have to use the woofer of the Z213, for less than 100 dollars you can combine an excellent experience.

This is a great set of little wired speakers. The sound is good for the size. There's absolutely nothing wrong with these and the only thing better are wireless speakers that are easier to have a clean desk.

These are definitely not the greatest speakers on the market, but they work very well when I prefer speakers over headphones. They are great for the price. Any audio work that requires accuracy should be done with headphones. A word of warning (at least for me) is that they require an external power cord, so make sure you have room.
They're not the best speakers in the world but they've served me well for a number of years. With my hearing, they're good enough!

Price: 20 Price (after tax): 21.79
Sound pretty good but noticeably not great. ..that probably made no sense. 7.5/10

These are definitely not the greatest speakers on the market, but they work very well when I prefer speakers over headphones. They are great for the price. Any audio work that requires accuracy should be done with headphones. A word of warning (at least for me) is that they require an external power cord, so make sure you have room.
They do the job

name: Logitech Z407 40 W 2.1-Channel Speakers
comments: These sound amazing for the price and have a wireless volume dial.

name: Creative Labs Pebble V3 16 W Speakers
comments: Sounds good

name: Yamaha HS8 120 W Speakers
comments: Not really PC related, but I thought I‚Äôd comment anyway. I‚Äôve had these studio monitors for years, as I do a bit of music on the side of PC stuff/work. I run them through a Scarlett 2i4 audio interface, which is a reliable little unit handy for small jam sessions. I tend to keep these monitors plugged in even when gaming (mostly because getting up to switch them on and off all the time is annoying, but hey - they‚Äôre active monitors - so it‚Äôs required!) - which is fine if you‚Äôre use to a flat EQ.

name: Edifier R1280DB-Brown 42 W Speakers
comments: They are active speakers, so make sure that's what you want before buying these. They don't seem to like being plugged to my computer. They sometimes stop working for no reason, and I have to reboot for them to behave again. They make a click when sound starts playing. They perform great when they are not acting up, and they weren't expensive, so I'm keeping them. I would have replaced them if I was using them for work, and not just gaming.

Received as a Christmas gift. Great all round speakers for gaming, music, netflix. These are plugged into my PC via digital audo cable and my work laptop via AUX. Additionally my phone is connected via Bluetooth.
Picked these up for about 40 euros, and I absolutely love these speakers. They look great, sound quality is amazing, and has bluetooth, coax and optical, couldn't ask for anything more
Nice speakers, unique look. Voice not as clear as PreSonus Eris.

name: NZXT Relay 80 W Speakers
comments: Small but mighty!

name: Logitech Z625 200 W 2.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
THX Certified audio
Designed to deliver the most accurate experience straight out-of-the-box. These THX Certified speakers are tuned to exact specifications to truthfully deliver the artist‚Äôs vision right into your living room.
400 Watts of powerful sound
400Watts of Peak / 200Watts RMS power delivers amped audio. This 2.1 system immerses you in crisp sound and thundering base whether you‚Äôre listening to music, watching an action-packed movie or playing your favorite video game. Enjoy powerful sound that you can hear and feel.
Versatile setup
Supports multiple inputs simultaneously including optical, 3.5 mm and RCA inputs. Connect up to three compatible devices such as your game console, television and computer. No need to disconnect when switching between audio sources.
All controls at your fingertips
Easily access power, volume, bass, headphone jack and auxiliary jack on the right satellite speaker.

comments:
On first setup, I was disappointed, but the neat thing about having an optical port on this system (and that's the only reason to buy these speakers) is you can run THX Spatial and Dolby Atmos for headphones through it, and in fact you can do both at the same time!
With a bit of software help they sound crisp and lively and suddenly become excellent value. (Seriously give those bits of software a try, free trials are available on both)
These are essentially just above average PC speakers, if you want better, buy Dolby Atmos, and pay the premium that entails.
Oh and they are too bass heavy, first thing any sane person will do setting them up is turn down the bass by 30-40%.

Found these on ebay for a really good price and sound more expensive than the really are. These beat my $400 Bose speakers in almost every category. Perfect for gaming and everyday tasks. Bass is extremely DEEP! Amazing full sound that fills the entire room can be heard throughout the entire house in low setting.
Good sound, solid construction, no issues. I know, some will say I need to use pro quality sound on my pc. If I need that, my listening room is equipped with KEF and Vienna Acoustics. It's a pc!
Great speakers at this price point.
great quality for the price
So loud I got yelled at within 30 seconds of turning it on. 10 of 10 Logitech
Amazing sounds and bass! Easy to dial in the sound just right.

Great speakers. These things are LOUD and almost no distortion. I'm no audiophile, but the sound is incredibly immersive. I paid extra for the digital optical version. Not sure how necessary that was.

name: AmazonBasics U213 2.2 W Speakers
comments: Crackly at loud volumes, and has an annoyingly bright blue led
The sound is decent, but theres always a buzzing ish noise unless I have the volume low.
Actually pretty good! Obviously nothing compared to, say, the Bose Companion II for $100 USD, but very good for the price! No bells and whistles here, just plain and simple speakers.
They're alright for what I need them to do.

name: Logitech Z533 60 W 2.1-Channel Speakers
comments: Decent sounding speakers for the price. However, in my opinion in certain music genres, the subwoofer overpowers the speakers, and on my unit sometimes the right side speakers stops working, until I crank the volume to a high level for a split second, and then it starts working properly, until you turn off the speakers.
These speakers convert your every day gaming experience into a fully imersive experience unlike any other. picks up lows very well, and it over delivers when it comes to bass.
Great to jam out to Spotify or in game. Nice bass sound. At just above 100 dollars, does everything I want it to do and then some.

Big heavy bass subwoofer causes the bass in any noise to be very loud and immersive. great if you are going for a brown and black colour scheme and since owning it and the easy to use volume controls i could never go back without having it. dont touch the speakers after touching it as the logo part is a fingerprint magnet and as other speakers dont press the cone in as they will never come back out.

use occasinoly when i listen to music. SUPER nice bass and audio quility, love blasting these but i will say i feel the left speaker is slighly not as loud as the right? This is more noticible at lower volumes.

Previously I had the 2.1 speakers from Creative Acoustics. Dont get me wrong, those speakers were great and they lasted me well over 3+ years. These speakers are definitely way nicer than the ones I had before and the sound isnt bad. Do not expect studio sound quality from these guys, but they are still really good.
My neighbours are always listening to AC/DC. Whether they like it or not!
Great 2.1 setup for a good price. They look really nice too.
good for bass and loudness but amp makes a idle hiss thats just enough to drive me insane

I needed a new set of speaker system that is wroth of quality, and I think this was it. I've been told Logitech are great, so I simply grabbed them without hesitation. The sound is very clear, and I overall like it very much.

name: Edifier R980T 24 W Speakers
comments: Loud and in your face, i love them.
Cheap speakers I got back then. They sound alright. Got a pair of Kanto stands, so I can put them on their side so my monitors do not block the sound.

I have the R1280T! They are loud and with very high BUILD quality! I'm not a sound expert so I cant describe how good or bad they are in terms of the sound so... The only bad thing about these speakers is the remote. It stopped working very fast and I dont know why... I checked it, everything seems to be fine, but it's not working...
great speaker, love the design aesthetic, plenty of power for my use case.
These are actually R1280T's.

name: Edifier R1700BT 66 W Speakers
comments: Good tabletop speakers, can work both with a cable and bluetooth, have long audio cables included.
I have the non-BT version (got them for 99$ CAD) and they are perfect. No distortion and sound is quite clear. Even compared to my passive B&W (made in UK) speakers they hold quite well!

These were purchased to be my main desktop speaker system after reading a number of reviews online. I have them connected exclusively via bluetooth and they have never missed a beat (pun intended). Sound quality for such well priced unit is much better than expected and certainly surprised me, the bass is strong with very good midrange performance. Connecting with my phone for quick music playback is very easy and the remote works well.
Very good branded bookshelf speakers @ 100 usd... Midrange and sound imaging is outstanding. Though somewhat lacking in bass response, overall provides a pleasing binaural experience.

name: Logitech Z200 10 W Speakers

specs.Features:
Rich stereo sound: Two 2; 5-"drivers per speaker pump out 10 watts peak power for clear stereo sound with added deep bass
Use with multiple devices: Plug in two devices at the same time, like your smartphone plus tablet or laptop, via a 3; 5mm audio input plus auxiliary line
Fingertip controls: On-speaker volume, power and bass controls for quick and easy audio adjustments
Handy headphone jack: Listen to music, movies and games in total privacy
High-quality acoustics: Tested and tuned at Logitech's state-of-the art audio labs

comments: Cheap speakers that does the job. No issues after 9 years.
They were cheap and the audio quality is good enough for a person like me.
Sound fine for my purposes, though I usually prefer headphones. They are dust and fingerprint magnets, though, and the power plug is chunky.
These 2.0 stereo speakers are pretty decent.
Suprisingly good for the price.
Cheap and does what a speaker should do. Nothing crazy impressive but as desk speakers they work well
Kinda ***, couldnt hear npc talk in game cause Sound was ***

$30 speakers that are better than my previous $20 speakers. Excellent budget choice if you just need speakers that sound decent without splurging on quality; they look nice and sound perfectly fine for their price.
the way the cables are connected is a bit annoying but theyre good overall
Great for $20-30 PC speakers. Not super distorted at higher volumes.

name: Razer NOMMO CHROMA Speakers
comments: Amazing sound quality, had em for 6 years and no static or noise issues. They look great too.

Basic desktop speakers seem to be hard to find. These aren't full featured, and I am sure there are better speakers out there, but I am so happy with these. The LED lights in the base compliment my build nicely.
The sound is good, and RGB sucks
The RGB on the bottom isn‚Äôt very noticeable which should reassure pc gamers who hate RGB devices. Definitely not the best audio speakers for a PC but definitely worth buying and trying out.
With or without LEDs these speakers shine like no other two speakers with such an affordable price tag.

I bought them to complete my Razer ecosystem, but that might not have been such a good idea. The Chroma lighting on them is so dim that it's not even worth it. They are way too bass heavy, even on the lowest setting. It basically drowns out all other frequencies. But I have to admit, they look great on my desk XD.
A very under-appreciated set of speakers. These guys pack a lot more bass than you'd think for a pair of 2.0 speakers. The price from them isn't too terrible either.
Incredible bass for a desktop stereo speaker. RBG ring on the bottom is a nice added bonus.
These things literally sound like surround sound when facing the right direction. Music with heavy bass sounds awful, but as gaming speakers, these are better than I could've imagined!

name: Audioengine A5+ Bamboo 150 W Speakers
comments: Amazing sound quality, I have zero complaints about these speakers. While a little pricey, they are the bee's knees when it comes to sound quality. I am currently using them paired with Audioengine's D1 DAC.

name: Logitech Z323 30 W 2.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
360-degree sound: Also known as omnidirectional acoustics, 360-degree sound helps project sound evenly in all directions, giving you a great listening experience throughout the room.
Ported, down-firing subwoofer: Delivers rich bass that brings music, movies, and games to life.
30 watts (RMS) of power: Fills the room with big, bold sound.
1 dual RCA jack and a 3.5 mm jack: Let you easily connect a Logitech Squeezebox network music player, DVD player, gaming console, or iPod.
Integrated headphone jack: Lets you listen in private whenever you want.

comments: I have had these for over 8 years and they still work like new.
These speakers have been really great so far, and a vast upgrade over the original logitech ones I had before.
Sounds good, look nice. Nothing else I can ask for.
Good 2.1 speaker setup for the full price, haven't had any issues with them in the 2 or so years I've used them.

Pretty solid, beats the speakers that you get on monitors for the most part and smashes the cheapo ones you can get at Five Below or the dollar store, BUT JESUS CHRIST WHY IS THERE SO MUCH BASS PLEASE TURN IT DOWN ON THE INCLUDED SUBWOOFER OR YOU WILL SHAKE THE FLOOR OF YOUR ROOM!
This is the first real set of speakers I've had, and oh man, I LOVE these! So clear, so deep, such good bass response! I'd expect them to cost more than this.
very loud and the sub gets nice and deep. almost too loud but thats why i got it. great for the price
Owned these for a few years now, Solid little unit.

Picked this up secondhand for only $9.99 and even at four or five times that price it offers great sound - the tiny subwoofer set near your feet under a desk can be cranked up to produce a toe-tickling rumble that's surprisingly strong for its size.
A particularly nice feature is that it evenly mixes the signal from up to three inputs, including a male 3.5mm, a female 3.5mm and a stereo RCA, so it's perfect for a multi-monitor, multi-machine setup and makes it easy to layer music from the collection on your mobile phone over the sound effects from your first-person shooter.
And if you're family or your roommate starts to complain about the din, there's a 3.5mm headphone jack right alongside the volume knob.
Only way to make this system better in my opinion would be to have a smaller profile but keep the loud and crisp sound signature

name: NZXT Relay 140 W Speaker
comments: Looks good, doesn't take up much space, nothing crazy.

name: Bose Companion 2 Series III Speakers

specs.Features:
Our most affordable computer speaker system puts Bose sound within reach
A performance upgrade over most conventional computer speakers
Contemporary, elegant appearance
Dual inputs for easy connection to computer and additional audio sources
Proprietary TrueSpace stereo digital processing circuitry creates a wide two-channel soundstage engineered specifically for listening at your computer.
Ported cabinet design provides fuller music and deeper movie/gaming special effects from a small enclosure.

comments: Absolutely THE BEST speakers for general use on pc. They have an exceptional audio quality, you can just FEEL the bass at higher volumes. The build quality is also amazing, as they (so far) have lasted 8 years for me, and I have yet to have a problem with them! It's just a shame that Bose no longer sells it (to my knowledge). Overall, this is a 10/10 product, and I recommend anyone with a budget of around $100 to buy it on eBay.
I don't use speakers too often, but these have been amazing.
great sounding audio with actual bass, impressed.
About the best speakers for a 3.5 jack you can get. To do better, you need a usb audio interface and some proper studio monitors.
Sound so good
Great to have when just listening to music or gaming without headphones.
Great speakers for the price. Didn't really notice a lot of bass like other people said. No complaints
Got these for xmas in 2019 and they are super good!
VERY bass heavy. As a result, vocals/acoustics are a bit muddy. But these things slap nevertheless.
Great Speakers and not overly expensive.

name: Cyber Acoustics CA-2014rb 4 W Speakers

specs.Features:
Volume control
Power on/off switch
Headphone output jack
LED power indicator
Magnetically shielded
Cloth gril

comments: It'll let you hear things... save yourself $15.

name: Edifier R1280DB-Black 42 W Speakers
comments: Great speakers so far only had them for a couple days though. Good sound quality, customizable bass and treble knobs. Great for listening to music and gaming.

name: Creative Labs Sound Blaster Katana V2 126 W 2.1-Channel Speakers
comments:
I don't have a ton of space on my desk for proper 5" monitors, so I've went with this soundbar from Creative instead. They can get loud which I like, the RGB diffusion looks great and the sound is pretty good too for both gaming or casual browsing, even while watching some shows or films.
It was pricy though.

name: Cyber Acoustics CA-3090 10 W 2.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features: Elegant and sleek, the CA-3090 is a 2.1 computer speaker system that offers you high quality sound without taking up too much desk space. The CA-3090‚Äôs satellites allow an optimal listening experience by providing impeccable clarity. The separate control pod turns the speaker on and off, while sporting an LED power indicator. Satellite volume is easily adjustable via the control pod, which also has an optional auxiliary input and headphone jack. With subwoofer control located within reach, the bass volume level is conveniently scalable. Use the handy mp3 player cradle to safely mount your mp3 player, iPhone, or iPod when connected. (mp3 player not included)

comments: Can't be beat for budget speakers, the subwoofer adds a LOT! Plus, the desktop "hockey puck" control is very handy, don't have to stretch to get at a volume control.
Great speakers for the price. I'm no audiophile, but with a little tuning on the subwoofer volume and positioning, everything sounds nice.
For the price, these things are pretty darn awesome. Obviously they're pretty entry level into the sonic circus but they'll do for some music and Youtube shenanigans.
Cheap price for a 2.1 speakers. Great sound quality and it has a control pod for headset jack and AUX.
Basic speakers. Can handle songs and gameplay quite easily.

I am extremely satisfied with these speakers. They do get a bit muddy when you crank them up, but that's to be expected. Compared to my old Logitech 2.0 speakers, these are amazing. I can actually hear those low notes now. For $35 these are a steal.

name: PreSonus Eris 3.5 2nd Gen 50 W Speakers
comments: these were a set of monitors i had leftover from when i still had the life id built. I was a musician.

name: Yamaha HS8 W 120 W Speaker
comments: Best mid-price speaker monitors for flat-response

name: Logitech Z333 40 W 2.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
80-watts peak power
Deep, intense bass
Convenient controls
Adjustable bass
Multiple device inputs
Add a Bluetooth Audio Adapter

comments: They sound good, but the tweeter (little speaker on top) is fake! Just a piece of metal! Shame!
I have had these speakers for 10 years. They are incredible.
When I'm running the flight sim out of speakers, the subwoofer feels like a real prop plane.
Very, very good speakers. If you can find them, they're worth purchasing.
Had these for years now, and they just keep working.

These speakers produced an excellent sound with lots of low end thanks to the subwoofer.
For the price, almost unbeatable.
Great speakers for the price. They get louder (and stay clear) than I would ever put it at.
Nice speakers that have great sound quality.

I wasn't super impressed with the sound, but it's a normal good sound quality. It gets really loud if you want it to, and the control node is very handy for volume. It turns smoothly and just makes the whole experience feel like the easiest thing of your life
My only complaint is that it isn't wireless. Plenty loud, clear and thundering bass for my PC.

name: Creative Labs T100 40 W Speakers
comments: Good Speakers for the price, these are place holders until my 5.1 system arrives. I've always liked Creative PC speakers, they have a good build quality and great sound. These ones in particular have good clarity and depth up to nearly max volume and will be going along my bedroom TV when replaced. My only gripe was the Aux cable supplied, which crackled and popped now and then at higher volume. Since replacing with quality gold plated audio cable, the sound is much clearer

name: Logitech Z213 7 W 2.1-Channel Speakers
comments:
Here I am going to use the same review for the same pieces:
I got the Z150 speakers to harmonize my work environment, they sound very good and if you are not a demanding audiophile but rather a guy who is enthusiastic about Micheal Bay and the deep basses of Laurent Garnier live at Elysee Montmartre, Paris, France they are ideal for you, however if you need to feel the bass of the Massive Atack Mezzanine you have to use the woofer of the Z213, for less than 100 dollars you can combine an excellent experience.
For the price, the audio is crisp and balanced. Bass is plenty for small to mid-sized rooms. If you want a set of speakers without annoying your neighbors, I'd recommend this.
Nice set of speakers for the price. Audio is crisp and the volume is more than enough to satisfy.
Carried over from previous build. Decent sound and relatively inexpensive.
e,e Barely use it , but for 35euro its great . I wanna get a 560 , but I barely use em so Maybe no.
Cheap, Good sound, don't look too bad.
Kinda disgusted at how good the audio is for only ~$30, not gonna lie. LOUD, and plenty of bass for a small to mid sized room.
Cheap. Sound good. Nice bass.

The main difference from the other Logitech speakers I had was the subwoofer and being able to tune the base of the sound. I'm not much of an audiophile so I don't really know what I'm talking about bye :)
Does the job but not very load. Also not a fan of the bass nob being on the sub-woofer. puts it way out of reach.

name: Kanto YU2MB 50 W Speakers
comments: great sounding bookshelf speakers at a perfect form factor for my desk
I never understood the hype around these but now I get it. If you buy these, please get the stands and the subs with it, it will take them to the next level.
better than any gaming speakers or speakers from peripheral brands, imo.

name: Creative Labs GigaWorks T20 Series II 28 W Speakers

specs.Features:
Precision-tuned, two-way speaker design: Enjoy well balanced audio with dedicated tweeters for sharp, detailed highs and robust mid-range drivers for rich, full sound.
Woven glass fiber cone driver: Experience rich, clear midrange audio and a broader sound stage.
Cloth dome tweeter: Hear crisp, detailed highs with a dedicated tweeter.
BasXPort technology for enhanced bass: Enhance the low frequency response without the bulkiness of a subwoofer.
Convenient access: Get the bass, treble and volume you want with the easily maneuvered controls. Plus, headphone jack and auxiliary in for easy connections.
Hear it on the big screen
Connect the speaker system to your TV or gaming console and enjoy solid audio entertainment.

comments: Work for me!
Great sound quality. The bass is very impressive for no subwoofer.

Beautiful sound quality. I got mine for $80 two years back and they're as good as new still.
Update Oct 2019: Going on a little over three years with these bad boys and I still love them. I'd HIGHLY recommend a pair. Might seem crazy due to the price, but I am very picky about audio quality and find myself nothing but completely satisfied by these. If you're a bass head, the bass is fairly decent at full crank, although it's not going to match a sound bar or an actual subwoofer (which should be obvious considering they're pretty small speakers). There aren't any pre-amp outs on these, but I'm sure you could figure out a workaround... if you so desired.
Pro tip (since I didn't mention this in my original review): there is a black mesh cover that comes with these speakers if you're not into the yellow. That makes them a whole lot more enjoyable for me, personally, as my setup is mainly black.
Old school, simple and punchy. When you're in headphones most of the time then having a simple fallback is always handy.

Unfortunately I don't have space to bring these two wonderful ladies with my in my new home, 'cause I'm taking with me 2 big-fat-KRK monitors.
I love this 2.0 system so much, it has a balanced sound and basses are great, so you don't need to place a stupid large subwoofer (2.1 systems) around your desk.
great budget speakers if you already have nice headphones but want speakers for your setup just in case you have friends over
Awesome pair of speakers for the money.

They're good enough. I have a 5.1 system for my consoles, so this isn't as good as that obviously, but still miles better from the speakers on my retiring laptop. Happy with the purchase as they also look wicked.
Pretty underwhelmed by the sound quality, to be frank. I own pretty good earpieces, so probably too used to that. The bass is pretty muddy, so if you listen to bass heavy music, don't expect much.

name: Kanto YU2MW 50 W Speakers
comments: Great looking, great sounding speakers. I love the compact form factor, matches my itx pc perfectly. They get pretty loud, and the bass is decent considering the size of the driver. I did add a 12" sub though, for movies mostly, but some times I turn it on for gaming as well. The only thing I'd change would be to have a way to cut the lower frequencies out so I can turn on the sub and crank these up louder. Overall I'd buy them again though

name: M-Audio BX5 D2 140 W Speakers
comments:
I bought this pair of speakers back in 2015, and they have been wonderful ever since. I went with M-Audio because I had just gotten an M-Audio midi controller shortly before these speakers and was impressed by the quality of the product. Doing some research led me to these, and they've never really disappointed me.
Letting them run for a few hours will inevitably make them warm up, but they never get HOT. I've left these things on overnight multiple times, and I always cringe at wasting power and possibly running the lifespan of the speakers down. But even after hours of running, they still stay a very reasonable temperature, and don't develop any noticeable problems with audio fidelity.
When I was on older laptops & desktops, I would get a speaker buzz due to ground loop. I think this is less the fault of the speakers themselves, and more a result of the power supply of the computer or laptop (i.e. not the PSU, but the actual circuit you're plugging into at the wall), and the unique audio hardware of each different computer. Your mileage may vary, but I had used a "Ebtech Hum X Voltage Hum Filter" from Amazon, and it cured all my ground loop buzz problems with these speakers and my set up in general.
Little blue LEDs are located between the tweeter and the main driver to indicate when they're on. These LEDs are bright. I put black duck tape over them for a few days when I was watching movies from bed and the only lights in the room were the computer monitor and these speaker power lights. It just bugged me mildly. It's not the kind of bright that's painful to look at, but these blue LEDs could distract from the overall aesthetic of your build or your desk set up, especially if blue clashes with your color scheme.
Love these speakers. Had them since 2012.
Great sound quality for the price.

name: Creative Labs Sound Blaster Katana V2X 90 W 2.1-Channel Speakers
SteelSeries Arena 3 US Speakers
comments:
Pros: Look nice, sound great.
Cons: None.

name: Creative Labs Sound Blaster GS5 RGB Soundbar 60 W Speakers
Creative Labs Creative Stage V2 80 W 2.1-Channel Speakers
Audioengine A2+B 60 W Speakers
comments: great sounding desktop speakers with bluetooth.

Expensive, but hard to beat for their size and build quality.
The sound quality is fantastic and I've never heard anything of this size sound this good. Don't expect them to get close to a proper set of 5" or 6" bookshelf speakers, but in my opinion the sound easily beats anything that Logitech or Creative sell at this size. They can easily blast music in a small/medium room, and they're great for gaming at your desk.
Build quality is also fantastic. The speakers come out of the box looking perfect. They have a very dense feel to them, and the paint finish is perfect all the way around. The volume knob (while inconveniently on the back) feels fantastic.
My main gripe with the speakers is the lack of a dedicated remote or controls to switch between inputs (it's just done automatically). This means you can't specifically turn Bluetooth off, or disable the USB input. For my use case (just using RCA) it isn't a problem though.
If you can grab these on sale I think it's worth it, but you might be able to match the sound quality with something like a Steelseries Arena. If you want something that looks fantastic on your desk, go no further.

name: Logitech Z506 155 W 5.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
Multiple inputs
Surround sound with 3D Stereo
75 watts (RMS) of power
Ported, down-firing subwoofer
Dedicated bass control

comments: These speakers are just OK in almost every respect. The price is OK, the sound quality is on the lower-end of OK, the volume is OK. These are about as middle-ground as a 5.1 speaker set for a PC can get, and that's OK.

Ok , yea Logitech again, bought this on sale as well. These speakers have a lot of sound, Wow do they blast. I will never have a problem with not hearing my game or music again, that is for sure. Comes with 5 speakers and a sub. I am only using 3 speakers and the sub, they still kick a lot of sound. Originally bought these to test them out and was going to move them to my living room tv for the better sound and surround sound. Yea that was the original plan, they are still at my computer, and they are staying. The tv will have to wait for another set or something else. ...LOL
Great speakers for the price. Perfect for a small room/gaming area when youre not trying to wear headphones.

Price dropped on these one day so I bought. I wanted a 4 speaker and sub system minimum for games and something to play music reasonably well. This seemed to be a good option in the research I did. So these sound amazing for a PC speaker I have to say. The sub is small but does well for that size, the frequency response is better than I expected. The sub level is on the sub which could be a hassle. They look cool, they perform great. I think you could use these for HT use in a smaller room. They get loud in a roughly 12' square room I have them in now, not blow you out the door loud, but loud for little speakers and can be heard on other end of house. They hook up with PC sound cables (included, grn/blk/ylw) or RCA, so no digital. Front right has power, volume, led, and a larger rs232 looking cable to the sub.

One of the more inexpensive sets of surround sound speakers you can get but surprisingly good sound for the price. The main speaker containing the volume knob oddly enough uses an RS-232 serial connector rather than USB. They do start to crackle slightly at high volumes.
'Tis a great speaker system
Bought this after trading $140 worth of dora the explora nintendo games to JBHIFI and after 4 years, its still running like a champ. Audio quality is superb and amazing.

I have had this speakers for over 2 years, and i have to say....They are still going strong! Besides getting some static from the speaker cause of near electronics, this speakers are just loud, is great! Only thing thing i don't like is that there is no Aux, so you can't use it to listen to music from your phone. I had some cheap ones back then that weren't good as this but at least it had an Aux. Though i can forgive them because the bass in this is too much, literally i barely have it half way and i can feel it the bass hard. Every speaker can also be tweaked so that each one plays a different instrument from the song, and when it syncs is just perfect!

This was referred to me by my cousin who got this set refurbished from Best Buy, I went out, tested, and bought it brand new. I haven't had a problem, and now with the games that I could play the 5.1 is better than any stereo system. I highly recommend this, it's a cheap way to get the most out of gaming. I do strongly suggest however to keep the bass to a minimum, it's still a very powerful system.
Great speakers for a great price.

name: Trust Asto Soundbar 24 W Speakers
comments: Really glad I got this the sound is pretty nice and clear & nice bass as well. For the price i couldn't be happier. For audio it uses the jack connectors and for power is a USB port so one can plug it to the PC or an adapter and directly to the power outlet.

name: PreSonus Eris E3.5 BT 50 W Speakers
comments: just awesome have them connected over a MOTU M4 on one PC and over a Focusrite Solo on the 2nd PC still abler to connect via BT and AUX huge Sound
They give good noise when I need it. No complaints here.

These sound great and are a steal for the price. I definitely could have just gotten some cheap Logitech speakers but the clairty and... feeling.. of these speakers are great. A bit bigger than I wanted/expected but for powered speakers they're perfect for me

name: Corsair Gaming Audio Series SP2500 232 W 2.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
Designed to be the reference standard in PC audio
232 watts of power provided by six Class D amplifiers
Bi-amplified, two-way satellites for clear, detailed reproduction
120 watt subwoofer for clean, accurate bass that fills the room

comments: Sounds good and not too expensive.

name: Creative Labs Sound BlasterX Katana 2.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
Under Monitor Audio System: So Sleek, Yet So Powerful
Aurora Reactive Lighting System: Light Up Your Setup
5-driver Design: Expertly Tuned Acoustics
Tri-Amplified Design: Put the Cutting Edge in Audio
High Resolution 24-bit Audio: Immerse Yourself in Your Games and Movies
Immersive 3D PC Gaming Audio
USB Audio: 7.1 Virtual Surround PC Gaming
Perfect for Late Night Games

comments:
GOOD
Less space than Premium speakers
Very good gaming/music quality
BAD
None

Amazing punch for it's footprint. No room for speakers, no problem. I'm amazed by the sound quality and volume of the soundbar.
Friends are always surprised when I play music or a game on this, as the bass punches, and the mids and highs are clear and not muddy.
Oh, it also has RGB!

Update: Do not buy this sound bar. It has a constant crackle/pop static noise with Windows 10 that won't go away. Creative's software support is also nonexistent. Save your money and go with Logitech or some other company with better support instead of just taking your money and ignoring your issues.

I don't know how I lived without a soundbar and sub when I was younger playing PC games. This is probably my favorite piece for gaming (and my girlfriend's least favorite). Playing doom eternal with the speakers blaring slaying demons is such a rush. Highly recommended. Also connected to my ps4.
Great 2.1 audio setup. It will cost you but it is the best PC soundbar on the market.

name: Creative Labs GigaWorks T40 Series II 32 W Speakers

specs.Features:
3-Driver audiophile configuration: Improve overall sonic spectral balance for music that sounds fuller, warmer and more faithful to the original source.
Woven glass fiber cone driver: Experience rich, clear midrange audio and a broader sound stage.
Cloth dome tweeter: Hear crisp, detailed highs with a dedicated tweeter.
BasXPort technology for enhanced bass: Enhance the low frequency response without the bulkiness of a subwoofer.
Convenient access: Get the bass, treble and volume you want with the easily maneuvered controls.
Hear it on the big screen: Connect the speaker system to your TV or gaming console and enjoy solid audio entertainment.

comments: Good sound!
These sound very good. Nice bass levels.
I fell in love with these the minute i tried them, best speakers I have ever used.
Great 2.0 speakers. Good bass too. You'd think it isn't possible yet here they are. Great if you don't want to use a lot of space for good sound.

name: Logitech Z337 w/BlueTooth 40 W 2.1-Channel Speakers

specs.Features:
Wireless audio via Bluetooth
80 Watts of Bold Sound
Strong bass
Wired connection
Simple controls

comments: great product, good connectivity and good looking.
These speakers are awesome, and the increased cable length over 2.0 speakers makes it a must have!
Great computer speakers! Sound quality is really good, and I actually find myself using these more often than my headset!

Very nice upgrade from Logitech's Z200 speaker setup. Definitely provides the bass quality and oomph that I was looking for! It also comes with much greater cable lengths, and the little volume knob looking device in the middle, sits well below my main monitor for easy on/off and volume adjustments.

Sound quality, bass, ease of use, etc. all perfect. For computer speakers, these sound absolutely crisp, with bass that reverberates all around the room. Audio enthusiasts should definitely look into these.
